qas.question: Who wrote the paper laying out hydrofoils and hydroplanes?
What did Bell start drawing after reading the article?
Who helped Bell investigate hydrofoils in 1908?
Which Italian scientist did Baldwin draw inspiration from?

context: The March 1906 Scientific <a1_0>American<a1_0/> article by American pioneer <a0_0>William E. Meacham<a0_0/> explained the basic principle of hydrofoils and hydroplanes. Bell considered the invention of the hydroplane as a very significant achievement. Based on information gained from that article he began to sketch concepts of what is now called a <a2_0>hydrofoil boat<a2_0/>. Bell and assistant <a3_0>Frederick W. "Casey" Baldwin<a3_0/> began hydrofoil experimentation in the summer of 1908 as a possible aid to airplane takeoff from water. Baldwin studied the work of the Italian inventor <a4_0>Enrico Forlanini<a4_0/> and began testing models. This led him and Bell to the development of practical hydrofoil watercraft.
